name: hyperfunctioning
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
A hyperfunctioning part of the body is unusually active or too active: Hyperfunctioning thyroid nodules are usually benign but may sometimes be malignant. The study provided evidence that these autoreceptors may be hyperfunctional in depressed patients.
More examplesFewer examplesIf it’s a hyperfunctioning nodule, you can pretty much rule out malignancy.Radioactive iodine becomes concentrated in the thyroid gland, where it irradiates and destroys the hyper-functioning tissue.
